subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Survivorship Bias: The Invisible Failures
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Survivorship Bias: The Invisible Failures.

hook.text: We study Steve Jobs and Elon Musk. We never study the thousands who did the same things and failed.

buildup.text: Survivorship bias means only seeing winners. The losers vanish from the story, distorting our lessons.

discovery.text: In WWII, engineers studied bullet holes on returning planes. Abraham Wald said: study the missing planes.

twist.text: Startup advice from survivors is dangerously misleading. Their strategies may have been irrelevant.

climax.text: For every 'drop out of college' success story, millions of dropouts struggle in silence.

punchline.text: The dead don't write advice books.

quiz.question: What is survivorship bias?
options: Focusing only on winners and ignoring the failures that are no longer visible
The tendency to believe you will survive any challenge
